dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S1789 IS: Training and Nutrition Stability Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Gillibrand (for herself and Mr. Ricketts) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to exclude as income certain payments received by household members from certain employment programs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Training and Nutrition Stability Act of 2025.

section.header: Exclusion of certain income from employment and training programs

subsection.text: Section 5 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2014) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (18), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (19)(B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: any payment, income, allowance, or earnings made to household members derived from—

subparagraph.text: any work program (as defined in section 6(o)(1)), unless the work program is established under—

clause.text: the Post-9/11 Veterans Educational Assistance Improvements Act of 2010 (Public Law 111–377; 124 Stat. 4106) or amendments made by that Act;
the Harry W. Colmery Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2017 (Public Law 115–48; 131 Stat. 973) or amendments made by that Act; or
the COVID–19 Veterans Rapid Retraining Assistance Program;

subparagraph.text: any employment and training program (as defined in paragraph (4) of section 6(d)) established pursuant to that section;
any vocational rehabilitation program (as defined in section 3 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3102)); or
any refugee employment program established under section 412(c) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1522(c)).

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (m) and (n) as subsections (l) and (m), respectively.

subsection.text: Section 6(s)(2) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2015(s)(2)) is amended by striking (m), and (n) and inserting and (m).
